clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial of a Low Protein Diet in Patients With Cognitive Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I/II Randomized Clinical Trial of a Low Protein Diet in Patients With Cognitive Impairment

brief_summary.textblock: The wide-acting effects of Fasting-Mimicking Diets (FMDs) on metabolic, inflammatory and regenerative pathways leading to reduced pathology or risk factors for various diseases in mice and humans, has the potential to be effective against Alzheimer's disease (AD). It is proposed to conduct a randomized clinical trial of twelve monthly cycles of the ProlonADTM diet (by L-Nutra) vs. placebo diet in patients with aMCI or mild AD (MMSE 18-23). The primary endpoint of the study will be the feasibility and safety of the twelve cycles of ProlonADTM.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a pilot, double arm randomized and prospective clinical trial assessing feasibility and safety of a 5-day low protein fasting-mimicking diet in pazients affected by Mild Cognitive Impairment or early Alzheimer disease.

primary_outcome.description: Safety of FMD in terms of percentage of patients experiencing adverse events and/or worsening of nutritional status. To obtain clinical data on safety of the FMD in MCI or AD patients as assessed by percentage of patients (%) experiencing > grade 3 adverse events and/or a significant decrease in their lean body mass (kg) and/or with a reduction of phase angle <5째 assessed with bio-impedance measurements.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients able to achieve the designated diet regimen
primary_outcome.description: Feasibility of FMD in terms of percentage of patients able to complete the diet regimen To evaluate the feasibility of the FMD in MCI and AD patients as assessed by the percentage of patients (%) able to achieve the designated diet regimen.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of conversion rate to AD
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of coversion rate to AD will be assessed with the conversion rate (%) from AD to aMCI

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of functional state
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of functional will be assessed with Barthel Index (BI) from 0 as the worse score and 100 as the best score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of emotional state
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of emotional state will be assessed with the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale Revised (CESD-R) with 0 as the best score and 80 as the worse score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of nutritional state
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of nutritional state will be assessed with phase angle with bioimpedance (째)

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of caregiver stress' level
secondary_outcome.description: Caregiver stress will assessed through Caregiver Burden Inventory (CBI) with 0 as the best score and 96 as the worse score

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of quality of life of patients with Quality of Life AD (QLQ-AD) with 13 as the worse score and 52 as the best score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of prevention of Frailty
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of prevention of Frailty with 40-item Rockwood frailty index (FI) with 0 as the best score and 1 as the worse score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of alzheimer and inflammatory biomarkers
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess the inflammatory markers, oxidative stress markers, neuronal damage markers (Neurofilament Light, NfL), quantification of circulating stem cells, cell aging markers (eg evaluation of the telomerase activity of lymphocytes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of episodic memory
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of episodic memory will evaluated with Free and Cued Selective Reminding Test (FCRST) with a range from 0 as worse score to 36 as best score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of general cognitive status
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of the FMD in terms of general cognitive status with mini-mental state examination (MMSE) with 0 as worse score and 30 as the best score.

arm_group.description: The ProlonADTM diet, which will be taken by the patient once a month for 5 days, is a low-calorie and low-protein diet, and provides all the micronutrients necessary to avoid malnutrition. The diet will be performed in twelve consecutive months. The components of the diet will be approximately 30% calorie restricted and 50% protein restricted but supplemented with 50% of the RDA in vitamins and minerals and also supplemented with both nonessential and essential amino acids identified in animal studies to be effective. Prolon by L-Nutra is a medically-designed dietary kit providing the food to eat for five days. Day 1 of Prolon provides ~4600 kJ (11% protein, 46% fat, and 43%carbohydrate), whereas days 2-to-5 provide ~3000 kJ (9% protein, 44% fat, and 47% carbohydrate) per day.
One meal which substitute or lunch or dinner for 5 days, without calories restriction.
